definition: to attack/to inherit/classifier for suits (esp. of funeral robes)

sentences.english: We must exploit tactical surprise to the maxima.
sentences.chinese: 我们必须发挥战术的奇袭效果到极致。
使用走壁奇袭攻撃累计打中敌人50回。

sentences.english: Jesus said it is going to happen as a surprise, so you need to be ready.
sentences.chinese: 耶稣说灾难会像个奇袭，所以你需要准备好。

sentences.english: That can be useful in group ambushes or surprise attacks.
sentences.chinese: 在埋伏和奇袭的时候隐身是很有用的。

sentences.english: Our surprise attack put the enemy into a flutter.
sentences.chinese: 我们的奇袭使敌人张皇失措。

sentences.english: My troops swooped down on the city.
sentences.chinese: 我的部队奇袭该城，并一举攻下。

sentences.english: The enemy reeled when surprised from the rear.
sentences.chinese: 敌军从背后受到奇袭而乱了阵脚。

sentences.english: It establishes him solidly as a bushwhacking coward.
sentences.chinese: 它表现出它奇袭时的胆怯与坚强。

sentences.english: But the loot that drops off of raid bosses will definitely be highly sought after.
sentences.chinese: 但是奇袭中老怪掉落的战利品绝对是非常值得追求的。

sentences.english: We beat up the enemy's quarters last night.
Some of the best items in the game will come from raiding.
sentences.chinese: 游戏中最好的物品有些从奇袭中获得。

sentences.english: It is going to be a surprise.
Surprise Attack on Pearl Harbor" is a well-known sea battle."
sentences.chinese: 《奇袭珍珠港》是一个著名的海战战例。

definition: to annihilate/to wipe out completely/to exterminate
to mount a sneak attack/to raid
raid/to carry out a raid/to invade
to besiege and strike the relief force (idiom); strategy of surrounding a unit to entice the enemy to reinforce, then striking the new troops
to seize control of (an enemy position)/(fig.) to take by storm/to gain (awards, control of a market etc)
